intro: Hyline paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense hyline, is a rare flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has thick, fleshy leaves adapted to retain water. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an important subject for botanical research. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
